conclusion: To compare the internal energy at state a and state c, we need to analyze the processes shown in the P-V diagram for an ideal gas.
Adiabatic processes involve no heat exchange with the surroundings, while isochoric processes occur at constant volume.
The internal energy (U) of an ideal gas depends only on its temperature (T). For an ideal gas, U = (3/2)nRT (for a monatomic gas).
From a to b: This is an isochoric process. Since volume is constant, there's no work done.
